page.title: 16FOREBODINGS OF THE PEOPLE
page.content: There are artists and architects in this remote parish , scientists and poets.Commentating on the changing character of Eskdalemuir one local voiced it thus."When the trees grow tall who will be here? With sickened gaze we have watched the slow earth- moving monsters ravage the bleeding soil - gash upon gory gash. Slowly, insidiously , the regimented rows of spindly spruce darken the landscape in endless march - silent, colourless ,no birds sing, no lambs bleat,no children call.When the trees grow tall who will be here ? Only a passing caravan , threading its careless way thrpugh forest maze ; only a tight-lipped team of the felling squad .The wheel will turn full circl. The trees grow tall for the executioner." A gloomy outlook indeed. Heartfelt . But was it justified?
